qas.question: What did an alternate version of the incandescent lamp substitute for a wire filament?

answers.text: an arc struck on a spherical bead electrode

qas.question: What was a common application for this type of bulb?
When was this style of lamp developed?
What displaced this style of lamp?
What type of lamp used a hot wire filament?

plausible_answers.text: A variation of the incandescent lamp

qas.question: What type of lamp did not use an arc struck on a spherical bead electrode?
What was not a common use for this type of bulb?
What type of lamp typically ran on relatively high voltages?
What type of lamp provided a low concentrated light that was harder to operate?
